intro: Triumfetta trilocularis, commonly known as the three-chambered triumfetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a three-chambered capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
